intro: Eriogonum latifolium subsp. westonii, commonly known as the broadleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive seed structures called achenes. This subspecies is often found in California and parts of Nevada, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
